title: Unit 2 Checkpoint: Linear Equations & One-Variable Reasoning
description: Summative checkpoint assessing multi-step equations (including variables on both sides), special cases (no solution / infinitely many), inequalities, and word problem translation.

remediationResources.reteachFocus: Distribute FIRST, combine like terms on SAME side, then isolate. Show every step — skipping causes errors. Always check by substitution.
Move all variable terms to one side (choose to avoid negatives); move constants to the other; solve. Check in the ORIGINAL equation.
If variables cancel and you get a TRUE statement (5=5): infinitely many solutions. If FALSE (5=3): no solution.
Same as equations EXCEPT: flip the inequality when multiplying/dividing by a NEGATIVE. Graph on number line (open vs closed circle).

assessmentProblems.question: Solve: 5x + 3 = 5(x + 1)
assessmentProblems.answer: 5x + 3 = 5x + 5. Subtract 5x: 3 = 5. This is FALSE → no solution.

assessmentProblems.question: Solve: 2(3x − 1) = 6x − 2
assessmentProblems.answer: 6x − 2 = 6x − 2. Subtract 6x: −2 = −2. TRUE → infinitely many solutions (all real numbers).

assessmentProblems.question: Solve and graph: −3x + 1 > 10
assessmentProblems.answer: −3x > 9. Divide by −3 (FLIP!): x < −3. Graph: open circle at −3, shade left.

assessmentProblems.question: A phone plan charges $25 per month plus $0.10 per text. Another plan charges $15 per month plus $0.20 per text. Write an equation to find how many texts make the plans cost the same. Solve it.
Maria has $120 and saves $15 per week. How many weeks until she has at least $300? Write and solve an inequality.
assessmentProblems.answer: 120 + 15w ≥ 300. 15w ≥ 180. w ≥ 12. Maria needs at least 12 weeks.

assessmentProblems.question:
ANALYSIS: A student solved 3(x−2) = 12 as follows:
   3x − 2 = 12
   3x = 14
   x = 14/3
Identify the error and find the correct answer.
assessmentProblems.answer: The student forgot to distribute the 3 to both terms: 3(x−2) = 3x − 6, NOT 3x − 2. Correct: 3x − 6 = 12. 3x = 18. x = 6. Check: 3(6−2) = 3(4) = 12 ✓

spiralReview.question: SPIRAL: Simplify (3⁴ · 3²) / 3⁵ and write as a single power of 3.

answerKeys.g8u2-10: Error: didn't distribute 3 to −2. Correct: x = 6.
